thread.title: China Market Volatility Weighs on Global Stocks
thread.title_full: China Market Volatility Weighs on Global Stocks - WSJ

author: Tommy Stubbington
title: China Market Volatility Weighs on Global Stocks
text:
0 COMMENTS Global stock markets fell Wednesday following another volatile session in China .
Chinese stock markets rallied into Wednesday’s close, with the Shanghai Composite Index closing 1.2% higher. Earlier it had fallen as much as 5%, sparking losses in a number of Asian markets.
Hong Kong’s Hang Seng fell 1.1%, while Japan’s Nikkei closed 1.6% lower.
Despite the late gains in China, the downbeat tone persisted in Europe. The Stoxx Europe 600 was 0.9% lower in early trade, wiping out the previous session’s small rally.
Germany’s DAX, packed with exporters highly sensitive to Chinese demand, fell 1.1%.
Later Wednesday, minutes from the U.S. Federal Reserve’s latest meeting should offer clues on the likely timing of the first interest-rate rise since the financial crisis.
With trading volumes lighter than usual during the summer holiday season, stock markets are vulnerable to “what should be familiar concerns over Chinese growth and U.S. Fed policy,” said Ian Williams, an economist and strategist at brokerage Peel Hunt.
In currency markets, the euro climbed 0.4% against the dollar to $1.1064.
In commodities, Brent crude oil was steady at $48.78 a barrel. Gold rose 0.6% to $1,123.00 a troy ounce.
Write to Tommy Stubbington at tommy.stubbington@wsj.com
